summary.originalText: This is how a spy movie is supposed to be.

originalText.plaidHtml:
If not the best movie that bollywood has put out in recent years. Would reccomend 100%. It's worth the 3Â½ hours of your life.

Everything from the legendary casting, raw action sequences to the gritty scenes. Overall, Dhurandhar succeeds because it understands that a thriller is only as strong as its characters. With Akshaye Khanna at the helm, backed by a perfectly tuned cast and gritty realism that stays with you long after the film ends, Dhurandhar is not just a movie-it is an experience well worth watching.

This movie delivers a strong storyline and impactful performances, but it's important to note that it contains frequent abusive and offensive language. While the dialogues may feel realistic within the context of the plot, they may not be suitable for all audiences - especially families or viewers sensitive to harsh vocabulary.

What censor board is doing????

Dhurandhar is an intense spy-action film with strong performances by Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna. The story is gripping and based on real events, with excellent direction and background score. However, the movie feels a bit long at times. Overall, it's a thrilling and impactful watch. Best movie.

originalText.plaidHtml:
It's a good movie with some strong performances, and the music works really well. I genuinely enjoyed the romantic portions; despite the age difference, the actors performed convincingly, and the film itself acknowledges that aspect.

The CGI isn't consistently impressive and at times feels a bit mid. Overall, it's a good watch inspired by certain true events...Waiting for Part 2 ðŸ’š

Dhurandhar is undeniably one of the finest Indian movies made this year. It is justifiably detailed, patient, and surely stirring. The performances of Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna are top-notch and truly stand out. The supporting cast is solid, with Sara Arjun and R Madhavan making their presence felt.

Not sure about the box office, but this film absolutely deserves its due. Filmmaker AdityaDhar and team merit the applause and our attention for this well-made espionage drama.

"The film is a masterclass in the espionage genre, delivering a perfect blend of heart-pounding action, intricate plotting, and genuinely surprising twists". It avoids the usual clichÃ©s, instead offering a fresh and intense take on the world of secret agents that is both clever and incredibly entertaining.

Best Bollywood spy movie ever trust me idk why there are so many people rating it negatively it's sucha good movie hats off to Aditya dhar for making this can't wait for part 2 it's gonna be blockbuster bollywood should learn from this movie how to make a movie how to build characters and Akshay Khanna stole the show in this part waiting for arjun Rampal to do in the part 2.

summary.originalText: Dhurandhar: A Gripping Spy Thriller That Delivers Intensity

originalText.plaidHtml:
This spy action thriller plunges into the dark underworld of Karachi's Lyari gang, where Indian agent Hamza Ali Mazhari (Ranveer Singh) goes undercover to dismantle terror networks. Loosely inspired by real events like Operation Lyari and geopolitical tensions, the film weaves espionage, betrayal, and raw patriotism into a sprawling narrative.

Ranveer Singh shines as the conflicted operative, delivering a restrained yet explosive performance full of charisma and vulnerability. He's brilliantly countered by Akshaye Khanna as the ruthless gang lord Rehman Dakait, whose menacing presence dominates scenes. The ensemble-R. Madhavan as the sharp IB chief Ajay Sanyal (echoing Ajit Doval), Sanjay Dutt as the fearless cop SP Chaudhary Aslam, and Arjun Rampal-adds layers of tension and depth.

Dhar crafts a Godfather-like saga with gritty action, realistic violence, and masterful tradecraft. The cinematography captures Karachi's shadowy streets evocatively, while Shashwat Sachdev's thumping score heightens suspense. At 214 minutes, the runtime allows rich world-building and character arcs.

originalText.plaidHtml: A Must watch film for cinema lovers. It is based of real life stories of our unknown man's operation in pakistan. It is based on famous Liyari underworld gangwar of Pakistan and how its agencies with help of these underworlds plan and orchestrate terrorist attacks in India. It also contains some sensitive graphic visuals.

summary.originalText: When Drama Runs Deep and Action Runs Wild

originalText.plaidHtml:
The director demonstrates exceptional skill in balancing intense action with emotional storytelling, political context, and underworld intrigue. Scenes are shot and edited to maximize both tension and clarity, giving actors space to deliver authentic performances
The film's success is a testament to the collaboration between talented actors and a visionary director who knows exactly how to extract the best from them.

Dhurandhar absolutely blew me away. What a gripping, intense, and unapologetic film! I loved every minute of it. The storytelling, performances, and raw execution kept me hooked from start to finish.

One of the things I appreciated the most is how boldly the film exposes the brutality shown by Pakistan's military and intelligence establishment in the story. It doesn't sugarcoat anything . It shows the harsh reality of cross-border aggression and the destructive mindset of those hostile elements. The film captures this with honesty and impact, without feeling exaggerated or filmy.

Ranveer Singh delivered one of his best performances, and the entire cast elevated the narrative beautifully. The action, emotion, intensity - everything landed perfectly for me.

For me, Dhurandhar is not just a movie, it's an experience. A must-watch for anyone who enjoys powerful, patriotic thrillers with substance.

Akshay khaana the goat actor u nailed it sir what an acting u nailed it amazing character of rehman dakkait was mind blowing whole actors one side and khanna sahab was on one side Oscar level acting even Sanjay dutt arjun rampal and ranveer Singh was awesome a fine film with OG actors after a long time bollywood made this amazing spy movie must watch movie....

Dhurandhar is a mind-bending thrill ride that fuses sharp storytelling with electric performances. Its twists unfold with surgical precision, pulling you deeper into a world where every choice matters. Visually bold and emotionally gripping, it leaves you breathless long after the credits roll.kudos to Aditya Dhar.

Watching the film feels like being pulled into a carefully orchestrated web of strategy, emotion, and raw energy. Ranveer Singh is in top form, portraying a layered character who is both vulnerable and formidable. The director's vision ensures that action sequences are purposeful, the stakes are clear, and the political subtext is never lost. Every supporting actor adds nuance, making the world feel lived-in and authentic. Cinematography captures the tension beautifully, and the background score amplifies emotional beats without overwhelming the story. This is cinema that challenges and excites in equal measure.

summary.originalText: Edge of the seat spy thriller.. not for weak hearted lefties!!

originalText.plaidHtml: Dhurandhar is not just a film; it is a statement of intent-bold, confident, and uncompromising. With its exceptional storytelling, memorable performances, and technical finesse, it fully deserves a 10/10 rating and is a must-watch for anyone who appreciates high-quality cinema. But intellectual liberals pls avoid... it causes severe heart burns and watery eyes...

I didn't like this flim Total waste of money ranveer singh not done good acting movie was too boring visually stunning epic where stylized violence and CGI create breathtaking, yet sometimes shallow, Spartan battles, praised for spectacle but criticized for thin characters and excessive gore, ultimately a feast for the eyes but perhaps lacking narrative depth beneath its crimson tide.

Dhurandhar sets a benchmark for films that demand both intelligent direction and nuanced performances. The director masterfully juggles political intrigue, underworld conflicts, and personal drama, guiding actors to deliver performances that feel lived-in. The lead carries the film effortlessly, navigating complex emotional and action sequences, while the ensemble cast provides layers of realism and depth. The pacing never falters, thanks to the director's understanding of timing and narrative rhythm. Subtle directorial touches, like framing and background score, heighten the actors' performances, making each scene impactful. This is a rare film where direction and acting combine flawlessly to create a cinematic masterpiece.

I'll be honest, when I saw the Dhurandhar trailer, I braced myself for another loud, self-indulgent ride like Animal. But what I got instead was a masterclass. Dhurandhar absolutely floored me. I genuinely don't understand why it's even being compared to Animal. This film is tight, focused, and surprisingly fat-free, despite being 3.5 hours long, a rare brilliance in editing and direction.

That final stretch... goosebumps.

When Akshaye Khanna tells Ranveer to stop the car, and that score kicks in, bro, that moment had me gripping the seat.

This is Aditya Dhar's magnum opus. He has crafted something bold, emotional, and cinematic without drowning it in noise. Go watch it.

summary.originalText: A Rollercoaster of Speed, Story, and Stars

originalText.plaidHtml: The story's deliberate unfolding allows suspense and character development to grow simultaneously. Ranveer Singh anchors the narrative with a performance full of nuance, from quiet investigative moments to explosive action sequences. Sanjay Dutt commands attention in every confrontation, while Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan deliver understated yet powerful performances. Arjun Rampal's quiet menace creates constant tension, and Sara Arjun's emotional depth provides grounding for the audience. Aditya Dhar's direction is masterful, blending intricate plotting with meticulously choreographed action. Cinematography captures both the sprawling chaos of urban landscapes and intimate human drama, and the score amplifies suspense at every turn. By the finale, the stakes escalate to a breathtaking crescendo, leaving audiences exhilarated and emotionally invested.
